page.title: 13Clubs
page.content: In our 'D' block we have two clubs. The cricket club can trace its history back to the 1800's,but was disbanded from about 1965 until it was reformed in 1981. It plays about 30-40 games a season against mainly other village sides although the team does travel to Cheltenham and Chipping Norton for games. It is fairly succesful and is a typical village side having about five good players and six who can occasionally score runs but who are normally out for 1 or 2 runs. The other club is the Manor Art Group who meet each Thursday at Temple Guiting Manor to draw and paint and receive advice from a retired teacher. They hold an exhibition and sale of work each year.
